results.title: The Sacrifice
results.brief_description: A narrative of courage, family and a life saved. Dragush’s father was dying of kidney failure. His father’s sister, Lina, travelled half way across the world to Australia from Albania, leaving her home and family behind, so that she could help save her brother’s life by donating one of her own kidneys. This story is a dedication to Aunty Lina and the importance of family.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: Tess the old girl
results.brief_description: Charming story about the amazing Tess and how she went from lost dog’s home to breakfast around the Tan, RSPCA Million Paws Walks, holidays and even bumping into the odd celebrity. This much loved dog has become part of the family and enjoys nothing better than chasing trucks , barking at possums, and pulling clothes off the line. Spoilt she may be but everyone loves the old girl.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: It's in the blood
results.brief_description: Sporting history runs in Darryl’s family. His grandfathers were champion cyclists Pat Veitch and Jack Forbes. His parents and his uncles also were all cycling enthusiasts and both Darryl and his brother inherited the sporting genes to become successful in athletics and football. It is this sporting background that Darryl feels has given him his values and made him what he is today.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: The Way I see things
results.brief_description: Ashleigh’s older step-brother has always been there for her. Growing up without a father she turned to her step-brother, learning from his experiences and cherishing the close bond that had formed between them - a bond that Ashleigh is determined to keep.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: Born to build
results.brief_description: Bodybuilding is more than just moving heavy metal. To Alex it is his life. Fascinated as a child with size and strength and an addiction to Marvel comics Alex finally starting pumping iron at the age of 16 and became hooked. Follow his journey in this humourous comic book style presentation as he lifts those weights and pumps that iron to build the perfect body.

results.title: The Little Frenchman
results.brief_description: Roger was a widower with no living relatives or close friends. His life experiences placed him in both world wars and post war migration. This is his story.

results.title: To my dearest beloved one - Shewitey Mearey
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. “I said to the doctor, I don’t care if I die tomorrow but I don’t want to leave my daughter alone. He said to me that first I had to live before I could have another child.”

results.title: Training for the last run
results.brief_description: Commonwealth gold medallist Raelene Boyle faced her toughest challenge in the fight against breast cancer. ‘My breast cancer diagnosis in 1996 did see me race again. This time it was a race to survive’. Created in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Journeys with Breast Cancer’ in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia.

results.title: Moomba belonged to my grandfather
results.brief_description: Moomba belonged to my grandfather, Tom Wittingslow. Of all the shows and carnivals we did all over Australia, Moomba was the best. A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Festival.
